intro: Mentha viridis var. laevigata, commonly known as narrow-leaf peppermint, is a variant of the peppermint plant characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. It is native to regions of Europe and western Asia, often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant produces small, pale blue to violet flowers arranged in whorls along the stem. It is valued for its aromatic properties and is used in herbal teas and as a source of essential oils. Its leaves contain high concentrations of menthol, contributing to its cooling and invigorating effects.
